com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common

Class PluginBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bukkit.plugin.PluginBase
      • org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin
        • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.PluginBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.bukkit.command.CommandExecutor, org.bukkit.command.TabCompleter, org.bukkit.command.TabExecutor, org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CommonPlugin

    public abstract class PluginBase
extends org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin
    The extended javaPlugin base used to communicate with BKCommonLib

    Handles dependencies, command registration, event listener registration, permissions and permission defaults, logging, error handling and localization.

      • getVersionNumber

        public int getVersionNumber()
        Gets the version of this Plugin parsed into a major-minor number. This expects the version of the plugin to be formatted like MAJOR.MINOR.REVISION.BUILD with separate parts not exceeding 100.
        REVISION and BUILD will not be contained in this version number!

        Examples:
        - v1.0 = 10000
        - v8.6 = 86000
        - v8.06 = 80600
        - v1.0.0 = 10000
        - v1.81.65 = 18165

        Returns:
        version parsed to an Integer

      • handle

        public void handle(java.lang.Throwable reason)
        Handles a possible throwable thrown somewhere in the Plugin
        If the throwable is too severe, the plugin is automatically disabled
        Additional exception types can be handled if needed
        Parameters:
        reason - to throw

      • getMetrics

        public Metrics getMetrics()
        Gets the Metrics instance for this Plugin, which is used to send statistics to http://mcstats.org/
        To make use of this functionality, first add the following line to the plugin.yml:
        metrics: true

        To avoid issues, call hasMetrics() before using this method to check whether Metrics is available.

        Returns:
        the Metrics instance used
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if no metrics is available

      • hasMetrics

        public boolean hasMetrics()
        Checks whether Metrics is available for this Plugin. Always call this method before using getMetrics() - initialization of Metrics could have failed!
        Returns:
        True if Metrics is available, False if not

      • onVersionCommand

        public boolean onVersionCommand(java.lang.String command,
                                org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender)
        Called when a command is postfixed with 'ver' or 'version'. By default displays the version information of the plugin and BKCommonLib. If those commands should be handled by #command(sender, cmd, arg), override this method and return false.
        Parameters:
        sender - to send version information to
        Returns:
        True if the version command was handled

        Returns:
        debugging version information
